title: How to Solve 3 books of physics, 4 books of chemestry, and 5 books of mathematics, are arranged in a shelf problem.
body:
Question: 3 books of physics, 4 books of chemestry, and 5 books of mathematics, are arranged in a shelf.
Find the probability that No physics book are together.

Ans: Total number of arrangements = 12!12!
Arrangements where no Physics books are together:
Step 1: Arrange the non-Physics books first (Chemistry + Mathematics)

There are 4+5=94+5=9 non-Physics books.

Number of ways to arrange these = 9!9!
Step 2: Place the 3 Physics books in the gaps between these 9 books:

There are 10 gaps (think: _ B _ B _ B _ ... _ B _).

We need to select 3 gaps out of 10 to place Physics books → (10! / 3!) ways.

Physics books can also be arranged among themselves → 3!3! ways.
So, favourable arrangements = ( 9!× (10! / 3!) ×3! ) / 12!
author: Sapan Gajjar
